title: Before you start
content:
Current Service Manager customers need to familiarize themselves with the OpenText Service Management application before starting down the Evolving to Service Management path. The following checklist provides information on the Service Management application and the differences between it and Service Manager.

The ITOM Practitioner Portal contains high level information on Service Management functionality, and provides discussion boards for communication with other users of the product. Information on the available features may be found here, as well as use case studies, and informative videos, information on the latest updates, 

While the processes and workflows in both tools are similar, there are several distinct additions and differences the administrators and users will encounter. Understanding Service Management best practices (and the key differences from those of Service Manager) will make the transition easier and allow the application owners to create proactive documentation and messaging for the end users to head off potential obstacles to a successful implementation. The Key Concepts and Way of Working sections of the Service Management documentation will help to prepare you for the next step on the Service Management Evolution journey.

The administration team should understand how configuration (including integration with external products) is performed in Service Management. While the workflow based configuration of the Studio in Service Management will be familiar to users of the Process Designer in Service Manager, there are several key differences in both the tools and the overall concepts. Understanding these concepts is critical in order for the required functionality to be implemented in the new application. 

Finally, understanding specific differences between the Service Management and Service Manager products will help guide key implementation decisions. It is important for the implementation team to read this specific chapter of the Way of Working guide to ensure that any process based decisions are made with the new functionality in mind.
